com.sabres

Class SabresQuery<T extends SabresObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sabres.SabresQuery<T>

  • public class SabresQuery<T extends SabresObject>
extends java.lang.Object
    The SabresQuery class defines a query that is used to fetch SabresObjects. The most common use case is finding all objects that match a query through the findInBackground(FindCallback) method, using a FindCallback. For example, this sample code fetches all objects of class "MyClass". 
     
 SabresQuery<MyClass> query = SabresQuery.getQuery(MyClass.class);
 query.findInBackground(new FindCallback<MyClass>() {
     public void done(List<MyClass> objects, SabresException e) {
         if (e == null) {
             objectsWereRetrievedSuccessfully(objects);
         } else {
             objectRetrievalFailed();
         }
    }
 });
    A SabresQuery can also be used to retrieve a single object whose id is known, through the getInBackground(long) method, using a GetCallback. For example, this sample code fetches an object of class "MyClass" for id myId. 
     
 SabresQuery<MyClass> query = ParseQuery.getQuery(MyClass.class);
 query.getInBackground(myId, new GetCallback<MyClass>() {
     public void done(MyClass object, SabresException e) {
         if (e == null) {
             objectWasRetrievedSuccessfully(object);
         } else {
             objectRetrievalFailed();
         }
     }
 });
    A SabresQuery can also be used to count the number of objects that match the query without retrieving all of those objects. For example, this sample code counts the number of objects of the class "MyClass". 
     
 SabresQuery<MyClass> query = ParseQuery.getQuery(MyClass.class);
 query.countInBackground(new CountCallback() {
     public void done(int count, SabresException e) {
         if (e == null) {
             objectsWereCounted(count);
         } else {
             objectCountFailed();
         }
     }
 });
    Using the callback methods is usually preferred because the database operation will not block the calling thread. However, in some cases it may be easier to use the find(), get(long) or count() calls, which do block the calling thread. For example, if your application has already spawned a background task to perform work, that background task could use the blocking calls and avoid the code complexity of callbacks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SabresQuery

        public SabresQuery(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Constructs a query for a SabresObject subclass type. A default query with no further parameters will retrieve all SabresObjects of the provided class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The SabresObject subclass type to retrieve.

    • Method Detail

      • getQuery

        public static <T extends SabresObject> SabresQuery<T> getQuery(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Creates a new query for the given SabresObject subclass type. A default query with no further parameters will retrieve all SabresObjects of the provided class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The name of the class to retrieve SabresObjects for.

      • or

        public static <T extends SabresObject> SabresQuery<T> or(java.util.List<SabresQuery<T>> queries)
        Constructs a query that is the or of the given queries. Previous calls to setLimit, setSkip, addAscendingOrder, addDescendingOrder or selectKeys are disregarded for the inner queries. Calling those functions on the returned query will have the desired effect. Calling where* functions on the return query is not permitted.
        Parameters:
        queries - The list of ParseQuerys to 'or' together.
        Returns:
        A ParseQuery that is the 'or' of the passed in queries.

      • addAscendingOrder

        public SabresQuery<T> addAscendingOrder(java.lang.String key)
        Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key. Multiple calls with different keys can be made to this and addDescendingOrder(String) functions for a single query.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to order by
        Returns:
        this, so you can chain this call.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setLimit

        public SabresQuery<T> setLimit(int limit)
        Controls the maximum number of results that are returned. There is no default limit. If not specified, all objects that match the query are returned.
        Parameters:
        limit - The new limit.
        Returns:
        this, so you can chain this call.

      • getSkip

        public java.lang.Integer getSkip()
        Returns the number of results to skip before returning any results for the current query.
        Returns:
        The number of results to skip. null if was not set (don't skip).

      • setSkip

        public SabresQuery<T> setSkip(int skip)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this, so you can chain this call.

      • getFirst

        public T getFirst()
           throws SabresException
        Retrieves at most one SabresObject that satisfies this query.
        Returns:
        A SabresObject obeying the conditions set in this query.
        Throws:
        SabresException - throws an exception if no object was found or if there was a problem with the query.
        See Also:
        SabresException.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND

      • getFirstInBackground

        public bolts.Task<T> getFirstInBackground()
        Retrieves at most one SabresObject that satisfies this query in a background thread. This is preferable to using getFirst(), unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Returns:
        A Task that will be resolved when the get has completed.

      • getFirstInBackground

        Retrieves at most one SabresObject that satisfies this query in a background thread. This is preferable to using getFirst(), unless your code is already
        Parameters:
        callback - callback.done(object, e) is called when the find completes.

      • find

        public java.util.List<T> find()
                       throws SabresException
        Retrieves a list of SabresObjects that satisfy this query.
        Returns:
        A list of all SabresObjects obeying the conditions set in this query.
        Throws:
        SabresException - Throws a SabresException if there was an error with the query.

      • get

        public T get(long objectId)
      throws SabresException
        Constructs a SabresObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the database.
        Parameters:
        objectId - The id of the object to get.
        Returns:
        Object id of the ParseObject to fetch.
        Throws:
        SabresException - Throws an exception when there is no such object or if there's a database error.
        See Also:
        SabresException.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND
